kernfrasen: opposing force to be reckoned with
triumphant over Satan on Satan’s own turf
the enemy's vote has been invalidated, annulled, canceled
following the course of this world

mapping_structuur.doel_element: The power to influence human history

cognitieve_implicaties: Evil is not just a lack of good but an active participant with agency.
theologische_implicaties: Human history is not a closed system between God and Man.
ethische_implicaties: Humility; we are not in total control of the outcomes of our actions.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Might imply God's sovereignty is subject to a democratic process.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Re-activates a military cliché to explain the complexity of the 'three-party drama' of the New Testament.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher uses the Iraq War as a consistent source domain to explain the 'Cosmic Drama' of Ephesians, successfully linking military strategy to spiritual reality.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The 'Writer' (God) is the one who determines the 'Conditions' (Military), merging sovereignty with narrative.

sterktes.beschrijving: Takes the dead metaphor of 'spiritual warfare' and makes it visceral through contemporary war reporting.
sterktes.voorbeeld: The description of the snipers versus the reflective sergeant.

risicos.beschrijving: The heavy use of Iraq War imagery might lead the hearer to conflate the geopolitical enemy with the spiritual enemy.
risicos.voorbeeld: Saddam Hussein is not the Enemy... he is in the grip of the greater Enemy.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation might view political enemies as demonically possessed rather than human actors.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A 2003 war zone (Iraq), specifically the tension between the Pentagon and field reports.
sub_worlds: Middle Earth (Tolkien's Lord of the Rings)
The inner world of a Marine Sergeant

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Highly effective in abstracting the 'Power of Evil' from specific politics.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: God is the 'Writer' and the one who 'outvotes' the enemy.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Introducing the 'Third Party' (The Enemy) to break the schema of human-centered free will.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Fits the 'Christus Victor' theme often found in Advent/Lent.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the Military/Conflict domain, which is used to dismantle a transactional view of faith. It successfully moves from a concrete source (Iraq War) to a literary source (Tolkien) to a theological target (Ephesians).

revitalisatie_suggesties.doel_metafoor: Washed in the blood / Saved by grace
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: God as a master sculptor working on a block of stone that the enemy tries to crack.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Connect the 'good works' to 'strategic maneuvers' in the cosmic drama.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Suggests God's power is limited by a process.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Clarify that the 'vote' is permitted by God's providence, not inherent rights.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To balance the violence of the military domain with the 'building' of the church.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to disrupt comfortable, human-centric theological schemas.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: CMT shows how the 'War' metaphor isn't just a 'cool' illustration but actually structures how the hearer understands the mechanics of grace.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Focuses on the cognitive mapping of concepts rather than the learning cycle of the listener.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals that the preacher is using 'Power' as a container that can be 'taken up' or 'filled' by different agencies.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Force' image schema.
